text: The Bible Belt is term for a part of the United States in which many people believe in conservative Evangelical Protestantism.Barry Vann (2008), In search of Ulster-Scots land: the birth and geotheological imagings of a transatlantic people, 1603–1703, Univ of South Carolina Press, , . Pages 138–140.S. W. Tweedie (1978) Viewing the Bible Belt. Journal of Popular Culture 11: 865-76 This makes it a dominant part of the culture. The Bible Belt is mainly located in the Southern United States. ==References== Category:Christianity in the United States Category:Regions of the United States
title: Bible Belt
